summary: Internal email correspondence among U.S. Attorney's Office staff discussing the technical applicability of the sex trafficking statute (18 U.S.C. 1591) to the charges against Jeffrey Epstein, noting the statute was enacted in 2000 after the alleged conduct.

persons.name: Blase, Nicholas
persons.context: Appears as a sender and recipient of internal emails within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing the technical details of charges against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Both are staff members within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, engaged in internal email correspondence about legal technicalities in the Epstein case.

events.title: Enactment of sex trafficking statute
events.description: The sex trafficking statute (18 U.S.C. 1591) was enacted in 2000.

keyFacts: The email discusses the technicality that the sex trafficking statute (18 U.S.C. 1591) used to charge Jeffrey Epstein was enacted in 2000.
It notes that the alleged conduct by Epstein occurred before the statute's enactment, raising a potential legal issue.
The correspondence is internal among U.S. Attorney's Office staff, indicating internal review or discussion of the charges' legal foundations.
